"John D. Heintz" <jheintz@...> writes:

> I like that definition of a resourcew, but how would you handle the
> problem of lost messages?
> John Heintz
> On 6/13/07, Ian Davis <lists@...> wrote:
>> On 13/06/2007 15:23, Paul Winkler wrote:
>> > So now we've got two hits. Bill's proposal has three; so far I still
>> What about a having a URI representing the end of the queue, e.g.
>> http://example.com/queue/last
>> A DELETE on that URI redirects with a 303 to the current last item in
>> the queue which is removed and returned in the body.
>> Ian

What John said and also how do you handle the fact that one client's
last is not necessarily another's. At the very least clients need to
identify themselves to the server. I used a personalised URI in
another email to meet that requirement. Once you do that, a pop can be
accomplished with at least two messages.

YS.
